snippet: Albany needs to raise the minimum wage to $8.50 an hour. It would not end poverty in New York, but it would make a difference for nearly a million people.
abstract: Editorial calls for New York lawmakers to raise the state minimum wage to $8.50 an hour from $7.25; argues that while the increase would not end poverty in New York, it would make a difference for nearly a million people.
lead_paragraph: Albany needs to raise the minimum wage to $8.50 an hour. It would not end poverty in New York, but it would make a difference for nearly a million people.

headline.seo: New York City on $15,000 a Year
